rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative adjective directly modifying a risk-adjective.
statement_text: No human cases have been documented from this strain of the avian flu in the U.S., and only one has been reported in Europe, said Todd Davis, lead of the CDC's zoonotic virus team in virology surveillance.

rationale: The segment reports factual information about human cases. No high-potency verb or metaphor.
statement_text: No human cases have been documented from this strain of the avian flu in the U.S., and only one has been reported in Europe, said Todd Davis, lead of the CDC's zoonotic virus team in virology surveillance.

rationale: 'have been documented' and 'has been reported' are not moderate verbs denoting impact. 'No human cases' and 'only one' are not significant scales.
